info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:05PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Schenectady, southern Saratoga and northwestern Rensselaer Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 204 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burnt Hills, or 9 miles north of Scotia, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saratoga Springs, Mechanicville, Ballston Spa, Round Lake, Galway, Country Knolls, North Ballston Spa, Burnt Hills, Rock City Falls, East Glenville, Malta, Charlton, Stillwater, Parkis Mills, Deans Corners, West Milton, Willow Glen, Coons, Garrison Manor and Wayville. People attending Saratoga Race Course (Horses), and Saratoga Performing Arts Center (SPAC) should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 between exits 10 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
